title: Romans 1:1
content: 1 Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, a called apostle, set apart for the gospel of God,

title: Romans 1:2
content: 2 which he promised beforehand by his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

title: Romans 1:3
content: 3 concerning his Son—the one having been born from a seed of David according to the flesh,

title: Romans 1:4
content: 4 the one having been designated the Son of God in power according to the Spirit of holiness by the resurrection of dead ones—Jesus Christ our Lord,

title: Romans 1:5
content: 5 through whom we received grace and apostleship for obedience of faith among all the Gentiles, for the sake of his name,

title: Romans 1:6
content: 6 among whom you also are called ones of Jesus Christ.

title: Romans 1:7
content: 7 To all the ones being in Rome, beloved of God, called saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Romans 1:8
content: 8 First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ concerning all of you, because your faith is being proclaimed in the whole world.

title: Romans 1:9
content: 9 For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how I continually make mention of you,

title: Romans 1:10
content: 10 always requesting in my prayers if somehow now at last I will be successful by the will of God to come to you.

title: Romans 1:11
content: 11 For I long to see you so that I may share with you some spiritual gracious gift to strengthen you,

title: Romans 1:12
content: 12 and that is to be mutually encouraged with you through each other’s faith, both yours and mine.

title: Romans 1:13
content: 13 Now I do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, that I often intended to come to you (but I was hindered until now), so that I might have some fruit among you also, just as also among the rest of the Gentiles.

title: Romans 1:14
content: 14 I am a debtor both to Greeks and to barbarians, both to wise ones and to foolish ones.

title: Romans 1:15
content: 15 So, as it depends on me, {I am} eager to proclaim the gospel also to you, the ones in Rome.

title: Romans 1:16
content: 16 For I am not ashamed of the gospel, for it is the power of God for salvation to all the ones believing, both to the Jew first and to the Greek.

title: Romans 1:17
content: 17 For the righteousness of God is revealed in it from faith to faith, just as it is written, “But the righteous one will live by faith.”

title: Romans 1:18
content: 18 For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, the ones holding back the truth in unrighteousness,

title: Romans 1:19
content: 19 because that which {is} known about God is visible to them, for God made it visible to them.

title: Romans 1:20
content: 20 For his invisible qualities, both his eternal power and divine nature, are clearly seen from the creation of the world, being understood by the things that have been made. So they are without excuse.

title: Romans 1:21
content: 21 For having known God, they did not glorify {him} as God, nor did they give {him} thanks. Instead, they became futile in their thoughts, and their senseless heart was darkened.

title: Romans 1:22
content: 22 Claiming to be wise ones, they became foolish,

title: Romans 1:23
content: 23 and exchanged the glory of the imperishable God for a likeness of an image of perishable man, and of birds, and of four-footed beasts, and of creeping things.

title: Romans 1:24
content: 24 Therefore, God gave them over to the lusts of their hearts for uncleanness, to dishonor their bodies among themselves;

title: Romans 1:25
content: 25 who exchanged the truth of God for the lie and worshiped and served the creation instead of the Creator, who is blessed to eternity. Amen.

title: Romans 1:26
content: 26 For this reason, God gave them over to passions of dishonor, for both their females exchanged the natural use for that {which is} contrary to nature,

title: Romans 1:27
content: 27 and likewise, the males also, having left the natural use of the female, burned in their lust for one another, male with male producing shameless acts and receiving in themselves the penalty which was necessary for their perversion.

title: Romans 1:28
content: 28 And just as they did not approve of having God in their full awareness, God gave them over to a disapproved mind, to do the things that are not proper,

title: Romans 1:29
content: 29 filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, {and} malice, they are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, {and} evil intent. {They are} gossips,

title: Romans 1:30
content: 30 slanderers, haters of God, insolent, arrogant, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

title: Romans 1:31
content: 31 senseless, faithless, heartless, {and} merciless.

title: Romans 1:32
content: 32 Who, having fully known the righteous decree of God, that the ones practicing such things are worthy of death, they not only do these things, but they also give consent to the ones practicing them.

title: Romans 2:1
content: 1 Therefore, you are without excuse, O man—everyone judging—for in that which you judge the other you condemn yourself; for you, the one judging practice the same things.

title: Romans 2:2
content: 2 Now we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against the ones practicing such things.

title: Romans 2:3
content: 3 But do you think this, O man, the one judging the ones practicing such things and you are doing the same things, that you will escape from the judgment of God?

title: Romans 2:4
content: 4 Or do you scorn the wealth of his kindness and forbearance and patience, not knowing that the kindness of God leads you to repentance?

title: Romans 2:5
content: 5 But according to your hardness and unrepentant heart, you are storing up for yourself wrath on the day of wrath and of the revelation of the righteous judgment of God,

title: Romans 2:6
content: 6 who will pay back to each one according to his deeds:

title: Romans 2:7
content: 7 Indeed, eternal life to the ones, according to endurance of good work, seeking glory and honor and incorruptibility,

title: Romans 2:8
content: 8 but to the ones from selfish ambition indeed being disobedient to the truth and becoming obedient to unrighteousness, wrath and anger.

title: Romans 2:9
content: 9 Tribulation and distress {will be} on every soul of man that produces the evil, both to the Jew first and to the Greek.

title: Romans 2:10
content: 10 But glory and honor and peace will be to everyone working the good, both to the Jew first and to the Greek.

title: Romans 2:11
content: 11 For there is no favoritism with God.

title: Romans 2:12
content: 12 For as many as have sinned without the law will also perish without the law, and as many as have sinned with the law will be judged by the law.

title: Romans 2:13
content: 13 For the hearers of the law {are} not righteous with God, but the doers of the law will be justified.

title: Romans 2:14
content: 14 For when Gentiles, the ones not having the law, do by nature the things of the law, they, not having the law, are a law to themselves,

title: Romans 2:15
content: 15 who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience bearing witness, the thoughts between themselves both accusing or even defending them

title: Romans 2:16
content: 16 on the day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to my gospel, through Christ Jesus.

title: Romans 2:17
content: 17 But if you name yourself a Jew and rely upon the law and boast in God,

title: Romans 2:18
content: 18 and know his will and approve of the things that are excellent, being instructed from the law;

title: Romans 2:19
content: 19 and you have become confident that you are a guide to blind men, a light to the ones in darkness,

title: Romans 2:20
content: 20 an instructor of foolish men, a teacher of little children, having in the law the form of the knowledge and of the truth,

title: Romans 2:21
content: 21 then you, the one teaching another, do you not teach yourself? You, the one preaching not to steal, do you steal?

title: Romans 2:22
content: 22 You, the one saying not to commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You, the one abhorring idols, do you rob temples?

title: Romans 2:23
content: 23 You, who boast in the law, do you dishonor God through the transgression of the law?

title: Romans 2:24
content: 24 For “the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,” just as it is written.

title: Romans 2:25
content: 25 For circumcision indeed benefits if you practice the law, but if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

title: Romans 2:26
content: 26 If, then, the uncircumcision keeps the requirements of the law, will not his uncircumcision be considered as circumcision?

title: Romans 2:27
content: 27 And the uncircumcision by nature, fulfilling the law, will judge you who {are}, through letter and circumcision, a transgressor of the law!

title: Romans 2:28
content: 28 For he is not a Jew who {is} one visibly, neither is this circumcision visible in the flesh,

title: Romans 2:29
content: 29 but the Jew in secret {is}, and circumcision {is} of the heart in the Spirit, not in the letter; whose the praise {is} not from men but from God.

title: Romans 3:1
content: 1 What then {is} the advantage of the Jew, or what {is} the benefit of the circumcision?

title: Romans 3:2
content: 2 Great in every way! For indeed first, that they were entrusted with the sayings of God.

title: Romans 3:3
content: 3 For what if some were unfaithful? Their unfaithfulness will not nullify the faithfulness of God, will it?

title: Romans 3:4
content: 4 May it never be! Instead, let God be true, but every man a liar. Just as it is written, “So that you might be justified in your words and you will prevail when you are judged.”

title: Romans 3:5
content: 5 But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God, what will we say? God {is} not unrighteous for imposing his wrath, {is he}? (I speak according to men.)

title: Romans 3:6
content: 6 May it never be! Otherwise, how will God judge the world?

title: Romans 3:7
content: 7 But if the truth of God through my lie abounds to his glory, why am I still being judged as a sinner?

title: Romans 3:8
content: 8 And not (just as we are blasphemed and just as some affirm us to say), “Let us do the evil things, so that the good things may come”?—whose judgment is just.

title: Romans 3:9
content: 9 What then? Are we better off? Not at all. For we have already accused both Jews and Greeks, all of them, of being under sin.

title: Romans 3:10
content: 10 Just as it is written: “There is none righteous, not even one.

title: Romans 3:11
content: 11 There is none who understands. There is none who seeks out God.

title: Romans 3:12
content: 12 All of them turned away. They together became useless. There is none doing kindness—there is not even one.”

title: Romans 3:13
content: 13 “Their throat {is} an opened grave. They keep deceiving with their tongues. The poison of asps {is} under their lips,”

title: Romans 3:14
content: 14 “whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.”

title: Romans 3:15
content: 15 “Their feet {are} swift to pour out blood.

title: Romans 3:16
content: 16 Destruction and suffering {are} in their ways.

title: Romans 3:17
content: 17 And they do not know a way of peace.”

title: Romans 3:18
content: 18 “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”

title: Romans 3:19
content: 19 Now we know that as many things as the law says, it speaks to the ones with the law, so that every mouth may be shut and all the world may become accountable to God

title: Romans 3:20
content: 20 because not any flesh will be justified by works of law before him; for full awareness of sin {is} through law.

title: Romans 3:21
content: 21 But now, apart from the law, the righteousness of God has been made visible, being witnessed by the Law and the Prophets;

title: Romans 3:22
content: 22 but the righteousness of God {is} through faith in Jesus Christ for all the ones believing, for there is no distinction.

title: Romans 3:23
content: 23 For all sinned and fall short of the glory of God,

title: Romans 3:24
content: 24 being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that {is} in Christ Jesus;

title: Romans 3:25
content: 25 whom God presented {as} a propitiation through faith in his blood for a demonstration of his righteousness, because of the overlooking of the sins that happened previously

title: Romans 3:26
content: 26 in the forbearance of God, for the demonstration of his righteousness at this present time, so that he could be just and justifying the one who {is} from faith in Jesus.

title: Romans 3:27
content: 27 Where then {is} the boasting? It is excluded. Through what kind of law? Of the works? No! But through a law of faith.

title: Romans 3:28
content: 28 For we reckon a man to be justified by faith apart from works of the law.

title: Romans 3:29
content: 29 Or {is he} God of Jews only? {Is he} not also of Gentiles? Yes, also of Gentiles,

title: Romans 3:30
content: 30 if, indeed, God {is} one, who will justify the circumcision by faith and the uncircumcision through the {same} faith.

title: Romans 3:31
content: 31 Do we then nullify the law through the {same} faith? May it never be! Instead, we uphold the law.

title: Romans 4:1
content: 1 What then will we say that Abraham, our forefather according to the flesh, has discovered?

title: Romans 4:2
content: 2 For if Abraham was justified by works, he has a boast, but not before God.

title: Romans 4:3
content: 3 For what does the scripture say? “And Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”

title: Romans 4:4
content: 4 Now to the one working, the wage is not credited according to grace, but according to obligation.

title: Romans 4:5
content: 5 Now to the one not working, but believing on the one justifying the ungodly, his faith is credited as righteousness.

title: Romans 4:6
content: 6 Even as David also speaks {of} the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:

title: Romans 4:7
content: 7 “Blessed {are those} whose lawless deeds have been forgiven, and whose sins have been covered.

title: Romans 4:8
content: 8 Blessed {is} a man whose sin the Lord does certainly not count.”

title: Romans 4:9
content: 9 Then {is} this blessedness upon the circumcision, or also upon the uncircumcision? For we say, “His faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness.”

title: Romans 4:10
content: 10 How then was it credited? Being in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? {It was} not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

title: Romans 4:11
content: 11 And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith that {he had} in his uncircumcision so that he would be the father of all the ones believing through uncircumcision, so that the righteousness would be credited to them;

title: Romans 4:12
content: 12 and the father of circumcision to the one {being} not only from the circumcision, but to the ones also following in the steps of the faith of our father Abraham in uncircumcision.

title: Romans 4:13
content: 13 For the promise to Abraham or to his seed that he would be heir of the world {was} not through the law but through the righteousness of faith.

title: Romans 4:14
content: 14 For if the heirs {are} from the law, the faith has been emptied, and the promise has been nullified.

title: Romans 4:15
content: 15 For the law brings about wrath, but where there is no law, neither {is there} transgression.

title: Romans 4:16
content: 16 For this reason {it is} by faith, in order that {it may be} according to grace, so that the promise might be certain to all the seed—not only to the one from the law, but also to the one from the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all,

title: Romans 4:17
content: 17 just as it is written, “I have appointed you the father of many nations,” in the presence of God whom he trusted, the one making the dead ones live and calling the things not existing as existing;

title: Romans 4:18
content: 18 who against hope believed on the basis of hope so that he might become the father of many nations according to what {was} said, “So will your seed be.”

title: Romans 4:19
content: 19 And not weakening in the faith, he considered his own body as already being dead (being about a hundred years old)—and the deadness of the womb of Sarah.

title: Romans 4:20
content: 20 But toward the promise of God, he did not waver in unbelief, but was strengthened in the faith, having given glory to God,

title: Romans 4:21
content: 21 and having been fully convinced that what he had promised, he is also able to do.

title: Romans 4:22
content: 22 And therefore, “it was credited to him as righteousness.”

title: Romans 4:23
content: 23 Now it was not written only for his sake, “It was credited to him,”

title: Romans 4:24
content: 24 but also for our sake, to whom it is about to be credited, to the ones believing in the one having raised Jesus our Lord from the dead ones,

title: Romans 4:25
content: 25 who was given up for the sake of our trespasses and was raised for the sake of our justification.

title: Romans 5:1
content: 1 Therefore, having been justified by faith, let us have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

title: Romans 5:2
content: 2 through whom we also have access by this faith into this grace in which we stand, and we boast on the basis of hope of the glory of God.

title: Romans 5:3
content: 3 And not only this, but we also boast in our sufferings, knowing that this suffering produces endurance;

title: Romans 5:4
content: 4 and this endurance, character; and this character, hope.

title: Romans 5:5
content: 5 And that hope does not disappoint, because the love of God has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit, the one given to us.

title: Romans 5:6
content: 6 For we still being weak, yet at the right time Christ died on behalf of ungodly ones.

title: Romans 5:7
content: 7 For someone will hardly die on behalf of a righteous {person}. Perhaps, though, someone might even dare to die on behalf of the good {person}.

title: Romans 5:8
content: 8 But God demonstrates his own love toward us, in that, we still being sinners, Christ died for us.

title: Romans 5:9
content: 9 Much more then, having now been justified by his blood, we will be saved through him from the wrath.

title: Romans 5:10
content: 10 For if, being enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, having been reconciled, will we be saved by his life.

title: Romans 5:11
content: 11 Not only this, but we also are boasting in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we now have received the reconciliation.

title: Romans 5:12
content: 12 For this reason, just as through one man sin entered into the world, and through sin, death, so also death spread to all men, because of which all sinned.

title: Romans 5:13
content: 13 For until law, sin was in the world, but sin is not charged, {there} being no law.

title: Romans 5:14
content: 14 Nevertheless, death ruled from Adam until Moses, even over the ones not having sinned in the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a pattern of the one coming.

title: Romans 5:15
content: 15 But not like the trespass, so also {is} the gracious gift. For if by the trespass of the one the many died, how much more did the grace of God and the gift by grace that {is} of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the many!

title: Romans 5:16
content: 16 And the gift {is} not as through one who sinned. For indeed, the judgment from one, to condemnation, but the gracious gift from many trespasses, to justification.

title: Romans 5:17
content: 17 For if, by the trespass of the one, death ruled through the one, how much more will the ones receiving the abundance of the grace and the gift of the righteousness rule in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

title: Romans 5:18
content: 18 So then, as through one trespass to all men {led} to condemnation, so also through one righteous act to all men {led} to justification of life.

title: Romans 5:19
content: 19 For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one will the many be made righteous ones.

title: Romans 5:20
content: 20 Now the law slipped in so that the trespass might increase. But where the sin increased, the grace abounded even more

title: Romans 5:21
content: 21 so that just as sin ruled in death, so also grace might rule through righteousness to everlasting life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

title: Romans 6:1
content: 1 What then will we say? Should we continue in the sin so that the grace might increase?

title: Romans 6:2
content: 2 May it never be! We who died to sin, how will we still live in it?

title: Romans 6:3
content: 3 Or do you not know that as many as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

title: Romans 6:4
content: 4 We were buried, then, with him through the baptism into his death so that just as Christ was raised from dead ones through the glory of the Father, so also we in newness of life might walk.

title: Romans 6:5
content: 5 For if we have become planted together in the likeness of his death, we will also certainly become {part of} the resurrection;

title: Romans 6:6
content: 6 knowing this, that our old man was crucified together {with him} in order that the body of sin might be nullified, {for it} to no longer enslave us to the sin.

title: Romans 6:7
content: 7 For the one having died has been freed from the sin.

title: Romans 6:8
content: 8 But if we died together with Christ, we believe that we will also live together with him,

title: Romans 6:9
content: 9 knowing that Christ, having been raised from dead ones, no longer dies; death no longer is lord over him.

title: Romans 6:10
content: 10 For that which he died, he died to sin once and never again. But what he lives, he lives to God.

title: Romans 6:11
content: 11 In the same way, you also must consider yourselves to be dead indeed to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus.

title: Romans 6:12
content: 12 Therefore, do not let sin rule in your mortal body, to obey its lusts.

title: Romans 6:13
content: 13 And do not keep presenting your members {as} tools of unrighteousness to sin. But present yourselves to God, as living from dead ones, and your members {as} tools of righteousness to God.

title: Romans 6:14
content: 14 For sin must not be lord over you, for you are not under law, but under grace.

title: Romans 6:15
content: 15 What then? Should we sin because we are not under law, but under grace? May it never be!

title: Romans 6:16
content: 16 Do you not know that to what you keep presenting yourselves {as} slaves for obedience, you become slaves to what you obey—whether of sin {leading} to death, or of obedience {leading} to righteousness?

title: Romans 6:17
content: 17 But thanks {be} to God that you were slaves of sin, but you listened from the heart to the pattern of teaching that you were given over to.

title: Romans 6:18
content: 18 And having been freed from sin, you became enslaved to righteousness.

title: Romans 6:19
content: 19 I speak as a man because of the weakness of your flesh. For just as you presented your members as slaves to uncleanness and to more and more lawlessness, so now present your members {as} slaves to righteousness {leading} to sanctification.

title: Romans 6:20
content: 20 For when you were slaves of sin, you were free with respect to righteousness.

title: Romans 6:21
content: 21 So what fruit were you then having because of which things you are now ashamed? For the outcome of those things {is} death.

title: Romans 6:22
content: 22 But now, having been freed from sin and having been enslaved to God, you have your fruit {leading} to sanctification, and the outcome {is} eternal life.

title: Romans 6:23
content: 23 For the wages of sin {is} death, but the gracious gift of God {is} eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

title: Romans 7:1
content: 1 Or do you not know, brothers (for I am speaking to those knowing the law), that the law is lord of the man for as long as he lives?

title: Romans 7:2
content: 2 For the married woman remains bound by law to the living husband, but if the husband dies, she has been released from the law of the husband.

title: Romans 7:3
content: 3 So then, the husband being alive, if she becomes {married} to another husband, she will be titled an adulteress. But if the husband dies, she is free from the law, so that she is not an adulteress, having become {married} to another husband.

title: Romans 7:4
content: 4 So then, my brothers, you yourselves were also made dead to the law through the body of Christ so that you might become {married} to another, to the one having been raised from dead ones, in order that we might produce fruit for God.

title: Romans 7:5
content: 5 For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions that {were} through the law were working in our members to produce fruit for death.

title: Romans 7:6
content: 6 But now we have been released from the law, having died to that by which we were being held, so that we might serve in newness of the Spirit and not in oldness of the letter.

title: Romans 7:7
content: 7 What then will we say? {Is} the law sin? May it never be! But I would not have known sin, if not through the law. For I would not have known the covetousness unless the law said, “You will not covet.”

title: Romans 7:8
content: 8 But sin, having taken opportunity through the commandment, produced all covetousness in me. For apart from law, sin {is} dead.

title: Romans 7:9
content: 9 Now at one time I was alive without law, but the commandment having come, sin came to life again,

title: Romans 7:10
content: 10 and I died. And the commandment that {was} for life, it was found {to be} for death to me.

title: Romans 7:11
content: 11 For sin, having taken the opportunity through the commandment, deceived me, and through it, killed {me}.

title: Romans 7:12
content: 12 So then, the law {is} indeed holy, and the commandment {is} holy and righteous and good.

title: Romans 7:13
content: 13 Therefore, did what {is} good become death to me? May it never be! But sin, in order that it might be shown {to be} sin through what {is} good, producing death in me so that through the commandment, sin might become sinful beyond measure.

title: Romans 7:14
content: 14 For we know that the law is spiritual, but I myself am fleshly, sold into slavery under sin.

title: Romans 7:15
content: 15 For what I produce, I do not understand. For what I do not want, this I practice. But what I hate, this I do.

title: Romans 7:16
content: 16 But if what I do not want, this I do, I agree with the law that {it is} good.

title: Romans 7:17
content: 17 But now no longer I myself produce it, but the sin living in me!

title: Romans 7:18
content: 18 For I know that there does not live in me, (that is, in my flesh), good. For the wanting is present in me, but the producing of the good {is} not.

title: Romans 7:19
content: 19 For I do not do the good I want; but the evil I do not want, this I practice.

title: Romans 7:20
content: 20 Now if what I do not want, this I do, I myself no longer produce it, but the sin living in me.

title: Romans 7:21
content: 21 I find, then, this law in me, the one wanting to do good, that evil is present in me.

title: Romans 7:22
content: 22 For I delight in the law of God with the inner man.

title: Romans 7:23
content: 23 But I see a different law in my members fighting against the law of my mind and taking me captive by the law of the sin that exists in my members.

title: Romans 7:24
content: 24 I am a miserable man! Who will rescue me from the body of this death?

title: Romans 7:25
content: 25 Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself serve with the mind the law of God, but with the flesh, the law of sin.

title: Romans 8:1
content: 1 {There is} therefore now no condemnation at all for the ones in Christ Jesus.

title: Romans 8:2
content: 2 For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus set you free from the law of sin and death.

title: Romans 8:3
content: 3 For what the law {was} unable {to do}, in that it was weak through the flesh, God {did}, having sent his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for the sake of sin, he condemned sin in the flesh,

title: Romans 8:4
content: 4 so that the righteous deeds of the law might be fulfilled in us, those walking not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

title: Romans 8:5
content: 5 For those existing according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those according to the Spirit, {on} the things of the Spirit.

title: Romans 8:6
content: 6 For the mindset of the flesh {is} death, but the mindset of the Spirit {is} life and peace;

title: Romans 8:7
content: 7 because the mindset of the flesh {is} hostility toward God, for it does not subject itself to the law of God, for it is not able {to do so}.

title: Romans 8:8
content: 8 But those existing in the flesh are not able to be pleasing to God.

title: Romans 8:9
content: 9 However, you yourselves are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, since indeed the Spirit of God lives in you. But if someone does not have the Spirit of Christ, this one is not of him.

title: Romans 8:10
content: 10 But if Christ {is} in you, the body {is} dead because of sin, but the Spirit {is} life because of righteousness.

title: Romans 8:11
content: 11 If indeed the Spirit of the one having raised Jesus from dead ones lives in you, the one having raised Christ Jesus from dead ones will also make alive your mortal bodies through his Spirit living in you.

title: Romans 8:12
content: 12 So then, brothers, we are debtors—not to the flesh to live according to the flesh.

title: Romans 8:13
content: 13 For if you live according to the flesh, you are going to die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the practices of the body, you will live.

title: Romans 8:14
content: 14 For as many as are being led by the Spirit of God, these are the sons of God.

title: Romans 8:15
content: 15 For you did not receive again a spirit of slavery {leading} to fear, but you received the Spirit of adoption, by which we cry out, “Abba, Father!”

title: Romans 8:16
content: 16 The Spirit himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God.

title: Romans 8:17
content: 17 Now if children, {then} also heirs: both heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ—if indeed we suffer together with {him} so that we may also be glorified together with {him}.

title: Romans 8:18
content: 18 For I consider that the sufferings of this present time {are} not worthy {to be compared} with the glory that is going to be revealed to us.

title: Romans 8:19
content: 19 For the eager expectation of the creation is eagerly expecting the revelation of the sons of God.

title: Romans 8:20
content: 20 For to the futility the creation was subjected, not willingly, but because of the one having subjected it, on the basis of hope

title: Romans 8:21
content: 21 that also the creation itself will be freed from the slavery of the decay into the freedom of the glory of the children of God.

title: Romans 8:22
content: 22 For we know that all the creation groans and labors in pain together until now.

title: Romans 8:23
content: 23 Not only that, but also we, having the firstfruits of the Spirit—even we ourselves groan within ourselves, eagerly expecting our adoption, the redemption of our body.

title: Romans 8:24
content: 24 For in this hope we were saved. Now hope being seen is not hope. For who hopes for what he sees?

title: Romans 8:25
content: 25 But if we hope for what we do not see, with endurance we are eagerly expecting {it}.

title: Romans 8:26
content: 26 Now in the same way, the Spirit also helps in our weakness. For the thing for which we should pray as we ought, we do not know, but the Spirit himself intercedes with inexpressible groans.

title: Romans 8:27
content: 27 But the one searching the hearts knows what {is} the mindset of the Spirit, because he intercedes on behalf of the saints in accordance with God.

title: Romans 8:28
content: 28 And we know that for the ones loving God, God works all things together for good, for the ones being called according to his purpose.

title: Romans 8:29
content: 29 Because those whom he foreknew, he also predestined {to be} a similar form to the image of his Son so that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.

title: Romans 8:30
content: 30 Now those whom he predestined, these he also called. And those whom he called, these he also justified. And those whom he justified, these he also glorified.

title: Romans 8:31
content: 31 What then will we say to these things? If God {is} for us, who {is} against us?

title: Romans 8:32
content: 32 He who indeed did not spare his own Son, but gave him up on behalf of us all, how will he not also with him freely give us all things?

title: Romans 8:33
content: 33 Who will bring an accusation against God’s elect? God {is} the one justifying.

title: Romans 8:34
content: 34 Who {is} the one condemning? Christ Jesus {is} the one having died—but more {than that}, having been raised, who also is at the right hand of God—the one also interceding on our behalf.

title: Romans 8:35
content: 35 Who will separate us from the love of Christ? Tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or hunger, or nakedness, or danger, or sword?

title: Romans 8:36
content: 36 Just as it is written, “For your sake we are being put to death the whole day {long}. We were considered as sheep for slaughter.”

title: Romans 8:37
content: 37 But in all these things we are more than conquerors through the one having loved us.

title: Romans 8:38
content: 38 For I am persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor governments, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

title: Romans 8:39
content: 39 nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which {is} in Christ Jesus our Lord.

title: Romans 9:1
content: 1 I speak truth in Christ. I do not lie—my conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit—

title: Romans 9:2
content: 2 that for me there is great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.

title: Romans 9:3
content: 3 For I could wish myself to be accursed, {separated} from Christ for the sake of my brothers, those of my own race according to the flesh;

title: Romans 9:4
content: 4 who are Israelites, of whom {is} the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the law-giving, and the service, and the promises;

title: Romans 9:5
content: 5 of whom {are} the fathers, and from whom {is} the Christ—(that {is}, according to the flesh)—the one who {is} over all, blessed God to eternity. Amen.

title: Romans 9:6
content: 6 But {it is} not such a thing that the word of God has failed. For not all the ones from Israel, these {are} Israel.

title: Romans 9:7
content: 7 Neither that all the children are seed of Abraham. But, “In Isaac your seed will be called.”

title: Romans 9:8
content: 8 That is, the children of the flesh, these {are} not children of God. But the children of the promise are considered as seed.

title: Romans 9:9
content: 9 For this {is} the word of promise: “At this time I will come, and a son will be to Sarah.”

title: Romans 9:10
content: 10 Now, not only this, but Rebekah also having conceived from one {man}, our father Isaac—

title: Romans 9:11
content: 11 for not yet having been born, nor indeed having done anything good or bad, so that the purpose of God according to election might endure,

title: Romans 9:12
content: 12 not by works, but by the one calling—it was said to her, “The older will be enslaved to the younger.”

title: Romans 9:13
content: 13 {It is} just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”

title: Romans 9:14
content: 14 What then will we say? {There is} no unrighteousness with God{, is there}? May it never be!

title: Romans 9:15
content: 15 For he says to Moses, “I will have mercy {on} whomever I will have mercy, and I will have compassion {on} whomever I will have compassion.”

title: Romans 9:16
content: 16 So then, {it is} not of the one willing, nor of the one running, but of God, the one having mercy.

title: Romans 9:17
content: 17 For the scripture says to Pharaoh, “For this very {purpose} I raised you up: so that I might demonstrate my power in you and so that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”

title: Romans 9:18
content: 18 So then, he has mercy on whom he wills, but whom he wills, he hardens.

title: Romans 9:19
content: 19 You will say then to me, “Why then does he still find fault? For who has ever withstood his will?”

title: Romans 9:20
content: 20 O man, who indeed are you, the one answering against God? The one molded will not say to the one having molded {it}, “Why did you make me this way?” will it?

title: Romans 9:21
content: 21 Or does the potter not have authority over the clay to make from the same lump not only what {is} a vessel for honor, but also what {is} for dishonor?

title: Romans 9:22
content: 22 But {what} if God, willing to demonstrate his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much patience vessels of wrath prepared for destruction;

title: Romans 9:23
content: 23 and so that he might make known the wealth of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he prepared beforehand for glory—

title: Romans 9:24
content: 24 even us whom he called, not only from the Jews, but also from the Gentiles?

title: Romans 9:25
content: 25 As he says also in Hosea: “I will call those {who were} not my people, ‘my people,’ and the one not loved, ‘Beloved.’

title: Romans 9:26
content: 26 And it will be that in the place where it was said to them, ‘You {are} not my people,’ there they will be called ‘sons of the living God.’”

title: Romans 9:27
content: 27 But Isaiah cries out concerning Israel, “Though the number of the sons of Israel might be as the sand of the sea, the remnant will be saved,

title: Romans 9:28
content: 28 for the Lord will carry out his word on the earth, finishing {it} and cutting {it} short.”

title: Romans 9:29
content: 29 And just as Isaiah has said beforehand, “If the Lord of hosts did not leave us a seed, we would have become like Sodom, and we would have been made like Gomorrah.”

title: Romans 9:30
content: 30 What then will we say? That the Gentiles, who are not pursuing righteousness, obtained righteousness, but righteousness that {is} by faith.

title: Romans 9:31
content: 31 But Israel, pursuing a law of righteousness, did not attain {it} through the law.

title: Romans 9:32
content: 32 Why? Because {it was} not by faith, but as by works. They stumbled over the stone of stumbling,

title: Romans 9:33
content: 33 just as it is written, “Behold, I place in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense, and the one believing on it will not be ashamed.”

title: Romans 10:1
content: 1 Brothers, the good pleasure of my heart and my prayer to God {is} on behalf of them for salvation.

title: Romans 10:2
content: 2 For I testify about them that they have a zeal of God, but not according to full knowledge.

title: Romans 10:3
content: 3 For not knowing about the righteousness of God, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they did not submit themselves to the righteousness of God.

title: Romans 10:4
content: 4 For Christ {is} the completion of the law for righteousness for everyone who believes.

title: Romans 10:5
content: 5 For Moses writes {about} the righteousness that {is} from the law: “The man having done these things will live by it.”

title: Romans 10:6
content: 6 But the righteousness by faith says thus, “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’” (that is, to bring Christ down);

title: Romans 10:7
content: 7 or, “Who will descend into the abyss?” (that is, to bring Christ up from dead ones).

title: Romans 10:8
content: 8 But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart.” This is the word of faith, which we proclaim.

title: Romans 10:9
content: 9 For if with your mouth you confess, “Jesus {is} Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from dead ones, you will be saved.

title: Romans 10:10
content: 10 For with the heart one believes to righteousness, and with the mouth one confesses to salvation.

title: Romans 10:11
content: 11 For the scripture says, “Everyone who believes on him will not be put to shame.”

title: Romans 10:12
content: 12 For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek; for the same Lord {is} of all, being rich to all the ones calling on him.

title: Romans 10:13
content: 13 For “all, whoever calls on the name of the Lord, will be saved.”

title: Romans 10:14
content: 14 How then would they call on {him} in whom they have not believed? And how would they believe in {him} whom they have not heard? And how would they hear without someone preaching?

title: Romans 10:15
content: 15 And how would they preach, unless they would be sent? Just as it is written, “How beautiful {are} the feet of the ones proclaiming good news {of} good things!”

title: Romans 10:16
content: 16 But not all of them obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our report?”

title: Romans 10:17
content: 17 So this faith {is} by hearing, and this hearing through the word of Christ.

title: Romans 10:18
content: 18 But I say, “Did they certainly not hear?” Yes, indeed. “Their sound went out into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.”

title: Romans 10:19
content: 19 But I say, “Did Israel certainly not know?” First Moses says, “I myself will provoke you to jealousy by a non-nation; by means of a senseless nation, I will provoke you to anger.”

title: Romans 10:20
content: 20 Now Isaiah is very bold, and he says, “I was found by the ones not seeking me; I appeared to the ones not asking for me.”

title: Romans 10:21
content: 21 But to Israel he says, “The whole day I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and contradictory people.”

title: Romans 11:1
content: 1 I say then, God did not reject his people, did he? May it never be! For I myself also am an Israelite, from the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

title: Romans 11:2
content: 2 God did not reject his people, whom he foreknew. Or do you not know what the scripture says about Elijah, how he pleads with God against Israel?

title: Romans 11:3
content: 3 “Lord, they killed your prophets, they tore down your altars, and I alone was left behind, and they seek my life.”

title: Romans 11:4
content: 4 But what does the divine response say to him? “I have reserved for myself 7,000 men who have not bent a knee to Baal.”

title: Romans 11:5
content: 5 In the same way, then, at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

title: Romans 11:6
content: 6 But if by grace, {it is} no longer by works. Otherwise this grace becomes no longer grace.

title: Romans 11:7
content: 7 What then? The thing Israel diligently seeks, this it did not obtain, but the elect obtained, and the rest {of them} were hardened,

title: Romans 11:8
content: 8 just as it is written: “God gave them a spirit of dullness, eyes not to see, and ears not to hear, until this very day.”

title: Romans 11:9
content: 9 And David says, “Let their table become for a net and for a trap, and for a stumbling block and for a retribution to them.

title: Romans 11:10
content: 10 Let their eyes be darkened to not see, and make their backs bend continually.”

title: Romans 11:11
content: 11 I say then, “They did not stumble so that they might fall, did they?” May it never be! Instead, by their transgression, this salvation {is} to the Gentiles, in order to provoke them to jealousy.

title: Romans 11:12
content: 12 Now if their transgression {is} wealth of the world, and their loss {is} wealth of the Gentiles, how much more {will} their fullness {be}?

title: Romans 11:13
content: 13 Now I am speaking to you the Gentiles. As much therefore as I myself am an apostle to the Gentiles, I glorify my ministry,

title: Romans 11:14
content: 14 if somehow I might provoke to jealousy my own flesh and might save some from them.

title: Romans 11:15
content: 15 For if their rejection {is} reconciliation of the world, what {is their} acceptance if not life from dead ones?

title: Romans 11:16
content: 16 Now if the firstfruits {is} holy, the lump {of dough} also. And if the root {is} holy, the branches also.

title: Romans 11:17
content: 17 But if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive branch, were grafted into them, and became partakers with them of the richness of the root of the olive tree,

title: Romans 11:18
content: 18 do not boast over the branches. But if you boast, you yourself do not support the root, but the root, you.

title: Romans 11:19
content: 19 You will say then, “Branches were broken off so that I myself might be grafted in.”

title: Romans 11:20
content: 20 {That is} true. They were broken off in unbelief, but you yourself stand firm in faith. Do not think arrogant things, but fear!

title: Romans 11:21
content: 21 For if God did not spare of the natural branches, neither will he spare of you.

title: Romans 11:22
content: 22 See, then, the kindness and the severity of God: severity on the ones having fallen, but kindness of God on you, if you continue in his kindness. Otherwise you yourself also will be cut off.

title: Romans 11:23
content: 23 But those, if they do not continue in their unbelief, will be grafted in. For God is able to graft them in again.

title: Romans 11:24
content: 24 For if you from what {is} by nature a wild olive tree were cut off, and contrary to nature were grafted into a good olive tree, how much more will these, who {are} according to nature, be grafted back into their own olive tree?

title: Romans 11:25
content: 25 For I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brothers, in order that you might not be wise in yourselves, that a partial hardening has occurred in Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in;

title: Romans 11:26
content: 26 and thus all Israel will be saved, just as it is written: “From Zion will come the Deliverer. He will turn away ungodly things from Jacob.

title: Romans 11:27
content: 27 And this {will be} for them the covenant with me, when I take away their sins.”

title: Romans 11:28
content: 28 Indeed, according to the gospel, {they are} enemies for your sake, but according to election, {they are} beloved for the sake of their forefathers.

title: Romans 11:29
content: 29 For the gracious gifts and the calling of God {are} without regret.

title: Romans 11:30
content: 30 For just as you yourselves were formerly disobedient to God, but now were shown mercy in the disobedience of these,

title: Romans 11:31
content: 31 thus also, these now were disobedient in your mercy so that they might also now be shown mercy.

title: Romans 11:32
content: 32 For God shut up all {people} into disobedience in order that he might show mercy on all the {people}.

title: Romans 11:33
content: 33 O, the depth of the wealth and the wisdom and the knowledge of God! How unsearchable {are} his judgments, and his ways beyond discovering!

title: Romans 11:34
content: 34 For, “Who has known the mind of the Lord or who has become his advisor?”

title: Romans 11:35
content: 35 Or, “Who gave to him, that he should be repaid by him?”

title: Romans 11:36
content: 36 For from him and through him and to him {are} all things. To him {be} the glory to the ages. Amen.

title: Romans 12:1
content: 1 I urge you therefore, brothers, by the compassions of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, well-pleasing to God, which {is} your reasonable service.

title: Romans 12:2
content: 2 And do not be conformed to this age, but be transformed by the renewal of the mind, so that you can approve what {is} the good and well-pleasing and perfect will of God.

title: Romans 12:3
content: 3 For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you to not think more highly of himself than what he ought to think, but to think with sound mind, as God has distributed to each one a measure of faith.

title: Romans 12:4
content: 4 For just as we have many members in one body, but not all the members have the same function,

title: Romans 12:5
content: 5 in the same way, we, the many, are one body in Christ and the {body} individually {are} members of one other.

title: Romans 12:6
content: 6 But we have different gracious gifts according to the grace given to us: if prophecy, according to the proportion of his faith;

title: Romans 12:7
content: 7 if service, in the service; if the one teaching, in the teaching;

title: Romans 12:8
content: 8 if the one encouraging, in the encouragement; the one giving, in generosity; the one leading, in diligence; the one showing mercy, with cheerfulness.

title: Romans 12:9
content: 9 {Let} love {be} without hypocrisy, abhorring the wicked, holding on to the good;

title: Romans 12:10
content: 10 in brotherly love, affectionate to one another; in honor, outdoing one another;

title: Romans 12:11
content: 11 in diligence, not lazy; in the spirit, being eager; serving the Lord;

title: Romans 12:12
content: 12 in hope, rejoicing; in suffering, being patient; in prayer, persisting;

title: Romans 12:13
content: 13 in the needs of the saints, sharing; pursuing the hospitality.

title: Romans 12:14
content: 14 Bless the ones persecuting you; bless and do not curse;

title: Romans 12:15
content: 15 to rejoice with those rejoicing; to weep with those weeping;

title: Romans 12:16
content: 16 thinking the same thing toward one another, not thinking the high things, but accepting the lowly ones. Do not be wise in yourselves;

title: Romans 12:17
content: 17 paying back to no one evil for evil; giving careful thought to good things in the sight of all men;

title: Romans 12:18
content: 18 if possible, what {is} from you, living at peace with all men;

title: Romans 12:19
content: 19 not avenging yourselves, beloved, but give way to {God’s} wrath, for it is written, “‘Vengeance {is} for me; I will repay,’ says the Lord.”

title: Romans 12:20
content: 20 But, “If your enemy is hungry, feed him. If he is thirsty, give him a drink. For doing this, you will heap coals of fire on his head.”

title: Romans 12:21
content: 21 Do not be overcome by the evil, but overcome the evil with the good.

title: Romans 13:1
content: 1 Let every soul be subject to governing authorities, for there is no authority except from God, and the existing {authorities} are appointed by God.

title: Romans 13:2
content: 2 So then, the one resisting that authority has opposed the command of God, and the ones who have opposed it will bring judgment on themselves.

title: Romans 13:3
content: 3 For rulers are not a terror to the good deed, but to the evil {deed}. Now do you want to not fear the authority? Do the good, and you will have praise from it,

title: Romans 13:4
content: 4 for he is a servant of God to you for the good. But if you do the evil, fear; for he does not carry the sword in vain, for he is a servant of God, an avenger for wrath on the one practicing the evil.

title: Romans 13:5
content: 5 Therefore, {it is} necessary to be subjected not only because of the wrath, but also because of the conscience.

title: Romans 13:6
content: 6 For because of this you pay taxes also; for they are servants of God, persisting in this very thing.

title: Romans 13:7
content: 7 Pay back to everyone your obligations: tax to whom tax, toll to whom toll, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.

title: Romans 13:8
content: 8 Owe nothing to no one, except to love one another, for the one loving his neighbor has fulfilled the law.

title: Romans 13:9
content: 9 For this: “You shall not commit adultery, you shall not kill, you shall not steal, you shall not covet,” and if any other commandment, it is summed up in this word: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”

title: Romans 13:10
content: 10 Love for a neighbor does not work evil. Therefore, love {is the} fulfillment of the law.

title: Romans 13:11
content: 11 And this, knowing the time, that {it is} already the hour for you to awake from sleep. For now our salvation {is} nearer than when we believed.

title: Romans 13:12
content: 12 The night advanced, and the day has come near. Let us therefore put off the works of the darkness, and let us put on the weapons of the light.

title: Romans 13:13
content: 13 Let us walk decently, as in the day, not in drunken celebrations or drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and uncontrolled lust, not in strife and jealousy.

title: Romans 13:14
content: 14 But put on the Lord Jesus Christ and make no forethought with regard to desires of the flesh.

title: Romans 14:1
content: 1 Now accept the one being weak in the faith, not for passing judgments on opinions.

title: Romans 14:2
content: 2 One person believes to eat anything, but the one being weak eats vegetables.

title: Romans 14:3
content: 3 Let the one eating not despise the one not eating, and let the one not eating not judge the one eating. For God has accepted him.

title: Romans 14:4
content: 4 Who are you, the one judging a household slave belonging to another? To his own master he stands or falls. But he will be made to stand, for the Lord is able to make him stand.

title: Romans 14:5
content: 5 Indeed, one {person} judges day from day, but another person judges every day {alike}. Let each one be fully convinced in his own mind.

title: Romans 14:6
content: 6 The one regarding the day, regards it for the Lord; and the one eating, eats for the Lord, for he gives thanks to God, and the one not eating, does not eat for the Lord; he also gives thanks to God.

title: Romans 14:7
content: 7 For none of us lives for himself, and none dies for himself.

title: Romans 14:8
content: 8 For if we live, we live for the Lord, and if we die, we die for the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or whether we die, we are of the Lord.

title: Romans 14:9
content: 9 For to this {purpose} Christ died and lived {again}, so that he might be Lord of both dead ones and of living ones.

title: Romans 14:10
content: 10 But you, why do you judge your brother? And you also, why do you despise your brother? For we will all present ourselves before the judgment seat of God.

title: Romans 14:11
content: 11 For it is written, “‘As I live,’ says the Lord, ‘to me every knee will bend, and every tongue will confess to God.’”

title: Romans 14:12
content: 12 So then, each one of us will give an account concerning himself to God.

title: Romans 14:13
content: 13 Therefore, let us no longer judge one another, but rather judge this: to not place a stumbling block for the brother or a trap.

title: Romans 14:14
content: 14 I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing {is} unclean by itself, except to the one considering anything to be unclean, for that one {it is} unclean.

title: Romans 14:15
content: 15 For if because of food your brother is hurt, you are no longer walking according to love. Do not destroy with your food that one for whom Christ died.

title: Romans 14:16
content: 16 So do not allow your good to be blasphemed.

title: Romans 14:17
content: 17 For the kingdom of God is not food and drink, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans 14:18
content: 18 For the one serving Christ in this way {is} well-pleasing to God and approved by men.

title: Romans 14:19
content: 19 So then, let us pursue the things of peace and the things of the building up for one another.

title: Romans 14:20
content: 20 Do not tear down the work of God on account of food. All things {are} indeed clean, but {it is} evil for the man who eats with a stumbling block.

title: Romans 14:21
content: 21 {It is} good not to eat meat, nor to drink wine, nor {anything} by which your brother stumbles [or is offended or becomes weak].

title: Romans 14:22
content: 22 The faith that you yourself have, keep according to yourself before God. Blessed {is} the one not judging himself in what he approves.

title: Romans 14:23
content: 23 But the one passing judgment is condemned if he eats, because {it is} not from faith. And all that {is} not from faith is sin.

title: Romans 15:1
content: 1 Now we, being able, ought to bear the weaknesses of the ones being unable, and not to please ourselves.

title: Romans 15:2
content: 2 Let each of us please his neighbor for his good, toward his building up.

title: Romans 15:3
content: 3 For even Christ did not please himself. Instead, just as it is written, “The insults of the ones insulting you fell on me.”

title: Romans 15:4
content: 4 For whatever was previously written was written for our own instruction, in order that through the patience and through the encouragement of the Scriptures we would have the hope.

title: Romans 15:5
content: 5 Now may the God of patience and of encouragement grant you to think the same with each other according to Christ Jesus,

title: Romans 15:6
content: 6 so that with one accord you might glorify with one mouth the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Romans 15:7
content: 7 Therefore, accept one another, just as Christ also accepted you, to the glory of God.

title: Romans 15:8
content: 8 For I say that Christ has become a servant of the circumcision because of the truth of God, to confirm the promises of the fathers,

title: Romans 15:9
content: 9 and also for the Gentiles to glorify God because of his mercy, just as it is written, “For this {reason}, I will confess you among the Gentiles and sing psalms to your name.”

title: Romans 15:10
content: 10 And again it says, “Rejoice, Gentiles, with his people.”

title: Romans 15:11
content: 11 And again, “Praise the Lord, all {you} Gentiles; and let all the peoples extol him.”

title: Romans 15:12
content: 12 And again, Isaiah says, “The root of Jesse will come, even the one rising to rule over the Gentiles; in him the Gentiles will hope.”

title: Romans 15:13
content: 13 Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing so that you might abound in this hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans 15:14
content: 14 But I myself am also persuaded about you, my brothers, that also you yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to instruct one another.

title: Romans 15:15
content: 15 But I wrote more boldly to you in part as reminding you, because of the grace given me by God,

title: Romans 15:16
content: 16 in order for me to be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, serving as a priest the gospel of God so that the offering of the Gentiles might become well-pleasing, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.

title: Romans 15:17
content: 17 Therefore, in Christ Jesus I have a boast {about} the things pertaining to God.

title: Romans 15:18
content: 18 For I will not dare to speak anything {except} what Christ produced through me for the obedience of the Gentiles—by word and deed,

title: Romans 15:19
content: 19 in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Spirit of God—so that from Jerusalem, and round about as far as Illyricum, I have fulfilled the gospel of Christ;

title: Romans 15:20
content: 20 but in this way, counting it honor to proclaim the gospel, not where Christ has been named, in order that I might not build upon another man’s foundation.

title: Romans 15:21
content: 21 But just as it is written: “Those to whom it was not reported concerning him will see, and those who have not heard will understand.”

title: Romans 15:22
content: 22 Therefore, I was also prevented these many times from coming to you.

title: Romans 15:23
content: 23 But now, no longer having a place in these regions, and having a longing from a considerable {number} of years to come to you,

title: Romans 15:24
content: 24 whenever I travel to Spain, I indeed hope, passing through, to see you, and to be sent ahead there by you, if I might first be satisfied for a while by you.

title: Romans 15:25
content: 25 But now I am traveling to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints.

title: Romans 15:26
content: 26 For Macedonia and Achaia were well-pleased to make a certain contribution to the poor ones of the saints in Jerusalem.

title: Romans 15:27
content: 27 For they were pleased, and they are obligated to them. For if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things, they are obligated also to minister to them in material things.

title: Romans 15:28
content: 28 Therefore, having completed this and having sealed this fruit to them, I will go away through you to Spain.

title: Romans 15:29
content: 29 But I know that coming to you, I will come in the fullness of the blessing of Christ.

title: Romans 15:30
content: 30 Now I urge you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, to strive together with me in the prayers to God for me,

title: Romans 15:31
content: 31 so that I might be delivered from the disobedient ones in Judea, and {so that} my service that {is} for Jerusalem might be acceptable to the saints;

title: Romans 15:32
content: 32 so that I might come to you in joy through the will of God, {and} might be refreshed together with you.

title: Romans 15:33
content: 33 Now the God of peace {be} with you all. Amen.

title: Romans 16:1
content: 1 Now I commend to you Phoebe our sister, also being a servant of the church which {is} in Cenchrea,

title: Romans 16:2
content: 2 in order that you might welcome her in the Lord, in a manner worthy of the saints, and might stand by her in whatever matter she might have need of you. For she has also become a benefactor of many, and of myself as well.

title: Romans 16:3
content: 3 Greet Prisca and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,

title: Romans 16:4
content: 4 who for the sake of my life laid down their own neck, to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles;

title: Romans 16:5
content: 5 and the church {based in} their house. Greet Epaenetus my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia for Christ.

title: Romans 16:6
content: 6 Greet Mary, who worked very hard for you.

title: Romans 16:7
content: 7 Greet Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and my fellow prisoners who are prominent among the apostles, who also have been in Christ before me.

title: Romans 16:8
content: 8 Greet Ampliatus, my beloved in the Lord.

title: Romans 16:9
content: 9 Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

title: Romans 16:10
content: 10 Greet Apelles, the approved in Christ. Greet the ones from the {household} of Aristobulus.

title: Romans 16:11
content: 11 Greet Herodion, my kinsman. Greet the ones from the household of Narcissus, the ones being in the Lord.

title: Romans 16:12
content: 12 Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa, the ones working hard in the Lord. Greet Persis the beloved, who has worked much in the Lord.

title: Romans 16:13
content: 13 Greet Rufus, the elect in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

title: Romans 16:14
content: 14 Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brothers {who are} with them.

title: Romans 16:15
content: 15 Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints {who are} with them.

title: Romans 16:16
content: 16 Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ greet you.

title: Romans 16:17
content: 17 Now I urge you, brothers, to watch out for the ones causing divisions and traps, contrary to the teaching that you have learned, and turn away from them.

title: Romans 16:18
content: 18 For ones such as these are not enslaved to our Lord Christ, but to their own stomach, and through their smooth speech and flattery they deceive the hearts of the unsuspecting ones.

title: Romans 16:19
content: 19 For your obedience reaches to everyone. I rejoice, therefore, over you, but I want you to be wise as to the good, but innocent as to the evil.

title: Romans 16:20
content: 20 Now the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet with haste. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ {be} with you.

title: Romans 16:21
content: 21 Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen, greet you.

title: Romans 16:22
content: 22 I, Tertius, the one having written this epistle, greet you in the Lord.

title: Romans 16:23
content: 23 Gaius, the host for me and for the whole church, greets you. Erastus, the steward of the city, greets you, and Quartus the brother.

title: Romans 16:24
content: 24 [The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ {be} with all of you. Amen.]

title: Romans 16:25
content: 25 Now to the one being able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, kept secret for long ages,

title: Romans 16:26
content: 26 but now having been revealed, and through the prophetic writings, according to the command of the eternal God, to the obedience of faith, to all the nations, having been made known,

title: Romans 16:27
content: 27 to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom {be} the glory to eternity. Amen.
